cards.markdown:
It’s been an interesting few days for the UK political system and the web. On the positive side [David �Dave� Cameron is blogging his trip to India](http://dcindia06.blogspot.com/).

The video on the blog reinforces the idea that he’s going for an approachable, ordinary bloke image:  
<embed id="VideoPlayback" src="http://video.google.com/googleplayer.swf?docId=6283090620586051994&hl=en-GB" style="width:400px; height:326px;" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"></embed>

Still, a few policies might be nice, too, Dave. how about it?

Meanwhile David Millibland’s latest venture onto the web – a wiki – has had to be [taken down because it was defaced](http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,17129-2339581,00.html). It’s a shame really. It was an interesting idea, but launching it at a time when the current government is rapidly reaching the nadir of its popularity was probably naive.
